newsitem.title: USA: CME live cattle calls mixed, feeders steady to up.
newsitem.headline: CME live cattle calls mixed, feeders steady to up.

text.p: Early calls on CME live cattle futures ranged from 0.100 cent per lb higher to 0.100 lower while feeder cattle futures were expected to open steady to up up 0.200 cent, livestock analysts said.

Further technical support and possible continued spillover support from feeder cattle futures may support live cattle futures. However, evening up ahead of the long holiday weekend and possible pressure from weak cash markets may keep futures in a narrow range, analysts said.
Deferred months look stronger on expectations of lighter fed cattle supplies later in the year, they said.

Feeder cattle look firmer following posting of new contract highs in some months Thursday with indications of lower corn futures also expected to encourage carryover demand. Yearling feeder supplies are seen very tight by fall and lower feed costs should keep interest for replacement feeder high, they said.
But profit taking could develop, especially ahead of the long holiday weekend, and bring uneven trade, they added.
The latest CME feeder cattle index was off $0.09 to $76.26 per cwt.
